title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: package aims provide functions similar Python’s set class.

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: package isn’t CRAN, can install using remotes. remotes::install_github("pythonicr/sets")

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: isdisjoint issubset issuperset union intersection difference symmetric_difference

what: Compute the Difference Between Sets — sets_difference
title: Compute the Difference Between Sets — sets_difference
text: set_difference returns elements x sets. function mimics behavior Python's set.difference() method.

title: Compute the Difference Between Sets — sets_difference
Compute the Difference Between Sets — sets_difference
text: x vector. ... Additional vector sets compare x.

text: vector containing elements unique x.

what: Check if Two Sets are Equal — sets_equal
title: Check if Two Sets are Equal — sets_equal
text: set_equal checks two sets x y contain elements. function similar Python's set.__eq__() method.

title: Check if Two Sets are Equal — sets_equal
Check if Two Sets are Equal — sets_equal
text: x vector. y Another vector compare x.

text: TRUE x y contain elements, otherwise FALSE.

what: Check if Sets are Disjoint — sets_isdisjoint
title: Check if Sets are Disjoint — sets_isdisjoint
text: sets_isdisjoint checks two sets elements common. function mimics Python's set.isdisjoint() method, returns TRUE sets disjoint.

title: Check if Sets are Disjoint — sets_isdisjoint

text: x vector. ... Additional vectors compare x.

title: Check if Sets are Disjoint — sets_isdisjoint
code: sets_isdisjoint(c(1, 2, 3), c(4, 5, 6)) #> [1] TRUE sets_isdisjoint(c(1, 2, 3), c(3, 4, 5)) #> [1] FALSE
